About:
__

Competitive advantage. The value chain. Five forces. Industry structure. Differentiation. Relative cost. If you want to understand how companies achieve and sustain competitive success, Michael PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s frameworks are the foundation. But while everyone in business may know PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s name, many managers misunderstand and misuse his concepts.

Understanding Michael Porter sets the record straight, providing the first concise, accessible summary of PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s revolutionary thinking. Written with PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s full cooperation by Joan Magretta, his former editor at Harvard Business Review, this new book delivers fresh, clear examples to illustrate and update PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ideas.

Magretta uses her wide business experience to translate PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s powerful insights into practice and to correct the most common misconceptions about themÃ¢â‚¬â€for instance, that competition is about being unique, not being the best; that it is a contest over profits, not a battle between rivals; that strategy is about choosing to make some customers unhappy, not being all things to all customers.

An added feature is an original Q&A with Porter himself, which includes answers to managersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ FAQs.

Eminently readable, this book will enable every manager in your organization to grasp PorterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ideasÃ¢â‚¬â€and swiftly deploy them to drive your companyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s success.
